messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Forefathers
messages.msgSnippet: Well, I don t care if a Communist lives in the Republic, as long as they let others live without their choice. The couple of people I know who lived in a
messages.messageBody:
Well, I don't care if a Communist lives in the Republic, as long as they let
others live without their choice. The couple of people I know who lived in a
commune ended up eventually having some sort of revelation, that hey, not
everyone has the same communal ideas, and some dictator type eases their way
into control. I am not saying that is happening to the communist on this
list(sorry, I forget you name), just what happened to people that I know.
Also, I am not sure if you live in the US.
As far as the reputation of the forefathers, well, to me who wrote the
constitution has nothing to do with its genius.
I am curious about an unschooling communist, because that sounds totally
contradictory to me. I think of Communists as trying to make everything
fair for everyone-not saying that I am accurate-just going by the socialists
ideas in the US. I don't understand the liberal view -of preventing someone
not to have what they want- if they are willing to take risks and live on
the edge and go for it. Who cares, if they want more stuff that equates more
headaches and responsibilities, let them live the way they want as long as
they are not hurting others or abusing the land.
Wendy
